My name is Farzana and I was born in Pakistan, in Faisalabad.
Now in English as well. My name is Farzana and I was born in Pakistan.
Where in Pakistan were you born?
I was born in Punjab, in a small town, Tomatek Singh.
My father, when he finished his job, he came to Faisalabad.
He lived there, he bought the shop before he was in the army.
When he finished in the army, he bought the shop and stayed near Faisalabad, near Tomatek Singh.
I was born there, and my brothers were born there. We lived our whole life over there, in Tomatek Singh.
I have a sixth brother, only sister. I was very, very spoiled.
I always played with the boys. I do play with the girls as well, but more with the boys, because in the house it's all boys.
I was in the middle. I was four older and two younger brothers. I was in the middle, so I just always played with the boys.
I have a very happy childhood. I have an education in Tomatek Singh as well.
Because in our house, education is more important than anything else.
What type of games did you play?
No girly games. I don't know the name or anything, but whatever the boys were playing, I just went and joined them and played with them.
They always called me Tom Boy. My eyes were always watering. I'm not a crime or anything.
I did education up to GCSE in Pakistan. As soon as I finished my education, I got married. Even the result came after I got married.
My husband and I went from here to Pakistan. It was an arranged marriage.
We got married and he came over and I didn't come with him because I didn't have a visa.
They always give us 18 months to apply and then they give us a visa. After 18 months, he went back and I came here.
What would you say is your favourite memory about childhood and also school?
School. I had a very good time in school.
My aunt built the school. She didn't have any children. She built the school and all the first children were us.
My cousins were very nice because my nephews and nieces all lived in one area and we stuck at the school.
After that, we were still there.
My cousins were older. I don't know how to explain it. It was very easy in school. I'm not very good with English.
English is terrible.

So here I am.
